title: Child dies after accidentally shooting self in Jefferson
content:
A 3-year-old sustained a fatal, self-inflicted wound after authorities said the child accidently discharged a handgun on Sunday in Jefferson.
The Georgia Bureau of Investigation and Jefferson police remained mum on Monday concerning the circumstances of the deadly shooting.
Jefferson Police Chief Joe Wirthman said no charges related to the shooting had been filed as of Monday and that the matter was turned over to the GBI.
Police responded about 2:20 p.m. Sunday to a report of a discharged handgun and a wounded child in a subdivision on Fairfield Drive in Jefferson, according to the Georgia Bureau of Investigation.
“Officers arrived on scene and identified the child as shot and disabled,” he said. “EMS came and did what they could and transported the child to Athens Regional (Medical Center), where the child passed away.”
The GBI released a statement noting they received a report “the child accidentally discharged a handgun.”
The name of the child was being withheld on Monday, the GBI said. Authorities have ordered and autopsy on the child.
